Steps to reproduce: 1. Drag and drop valid TSV input 2. View file statistics 3. Click 'Start Harvest'
Expected result: File validates instantly, displays exact unique/invalid/duplicate count, and harvest begins without crashing
Actual result: File parses correctly using unified helper, stats match perfectly, pipeline engages seamlessly

Steps to reproduce: 1. Click Start Harvest 2. Click Pause 3. Click Resume 4. Click Cancel
Expected result: Harvest toggles states dynamically and UI updates corresponding button usability (e.g. Pause turns to Resume)
Actual result: Worker thread correctly pauses yield loop and gracefully interrupts upon Cancel.

Steps to reproduce: 1. Upload test validation TSV containing spaces, missing digits, and multiple identical lines
Expected result: Pre-harvest validates ISBNs exactly correctly, UI splits 'Loaded ISBNs' from total file rows, and live stats reflect exact processing count
Actual result: Accurately detected 3 unique valid rows minus 3 duplicates and 2 invalids.
Notes: Math formulas for counts were previously mismatched. Rewrote backend to use the exact same parser for both GUI and Database.

Steps to reproduce: 1. Load App (without file) 2. Upload TSV 3. Click 'Clear'
Expected result: Button is disabled gray initially, turns red 'DangerButton' instantly upon upload, completely clears UI and resets when clicked
Actual result: Button toggles states perfectly. Emoji/text scaling issue bypassed.
Notes: Had to fix OS-level text clipping by relying on generic DangerButton CSS instead of fixed 30x30 bounding box hacks.

Expected result: Pings LOC, Harvard, OpenLibrary domains simultaneously for latency tests

Steps to reproduce: 1. Start unified tab 2. Maximize window quickly 3. Shrink to narrow width
Expected result: Flexible layout components flex appropriately horizontally, errors are printed inline instead of spawning infinite popups
Actual result: Scroll area anchors and expands. Inline logging successfully avoids OS interrupt popups.
